verses.roman:
nanṛtus tasya purataḥ
striyo 'tho gāyakā jaguḥ
mṛdaṅga-vīṇā-paṇavair
vādyaṁ cakrur mano-ramam

synonyms: nanṛtuḥ—danced; tasya—of him; purataḥ—in front; striyaḥ—women; atha u—and furthermore; gāyakāḥ—singers; jaguḥ—sang; mṛdaṅga—with drums; vīṇā—stringed instruments; paṇavaiḥ—and cymbals; vādyam—instrumental music; cakruḥ—they made; manaḥ-ramam—charming.
translation: The women danced before the sage, and the celestial singers sang to the charming accompaniment of drums, cymbals and vīṇās.
